William Head Institution Garbage Removal and Waste Services \-\-This requirement is for: The Correctional Service of Canada, Pacific Region, William Head Institution. \-\-Trade agreement: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), Canada free trade agreements with Chile/Colombia/Honduras/Panama, Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement, Canada Korea Trade Agreement (CKTA). \-\-Tendering procedures: All interested suppliers may submit a bid.\-\-Competitive Procurement Strategy: lowest priced compliant bid. \-\-Set-aside under the Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business: \-\-C This procurement is not subject to any set-asides for Indigenous Suppliers.\-\-Comprehensive Land Claim Agreement: \-\-This procurement is not subject to a Comprehensive Land Claims Agreement.\ \-Security Requirements: \-\- This contract does not include security requirements.\ \-Nature of Requirements: \-\-\-The following is a summary of the statement of work for this requirement. \-\-The Correctional Service Canada has a requirement to remove and dispose of non-organic garbage waste, mixed recyclables, and waste wood items from William Head Institution in Metchosin on Vancouver Island B.C.\-\-Objectives: The contractor must provide comprehensive services that consist of scheduled and on call removal of all non-organic garbage waste, mixed recyclables, and waste wood items.\-\-The Contractor must remove and dispose of all non-organic waste, mixed recyclables and wood waste in accordance with the Environmental Management Act in the province of BC and all municipal, provincial and federal bylaws and regulations that apply. The Contractor must take all waste streams for disposal to only authorized waste disposal facilities. The Contractor must adhere to all rules and procedures in effect at all disposal facilities.\-\-Deliverables: The Contractor must provide scheduled and on call pick-ups for the disposal of three 
distinct streams of waste for the Correctional Service Canada. The Contractor must provide all 
required waste containers. The contractor must provide all labour, vehicles and trucks, fuel, maintenance, 
installation and removal of rental containers in order to remove, transport and dispose of all non organic
garbage waste, mixed recycles and wood waste at William Head Institution.\ \

**Garbage Removal and Waste Management Services**
=============================================

**Notice Type**: Request for Proposal
**Procurement Method**: Competitive - Open Bidding
**Award Method**: Lowest Price

**Bidder Information**
--------------------

* **Bidder Name**: [Procurement Information upon Request]
* **Bidder Address**: [Procurement Information upon Request]
* **Bidder Contact**: Katie McKeever, [katie.mckeever@csc-scc.gc.ca](mailto:katie.mckeever@csc-scc.gc.ca)

**Contract Details**
------------------

* **Contract Title**: Garbage Removal and Waste Services
* **Contract Number**: 21820-23-0159
* **Awarding Authority**: Correctional Service Canada
* **Location**: William Head Institution, Metchosin, British Columbia

**Statement of Work**
---------------------

The Correctional Service Canada requires a contractor to provide comprehensive garbage removal and waste management services at William Head Institution in Metchosin, British Columbia. The services include:

* Scheduled and on-call removal of non-organic waste, mixed recyclables, and wood waste
* Transportation and disposal of waste at authorized facilities
* Providing all required labor, vehicles, and equipment

**Contract Term**
----------------

The contract will be effective from July 29, 2024, to July 28, 2029.

**Trade Agreements**
------------------

This contract is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), and other applicable trade agreements.

**Bidder Requirements**
---------------------

* Bidder must be a registered supplier with the Government of Canada
* Bidder must meet the eligibility criteria outlined in the bid document

**Solicitation Documents**
-------------------------

The solicitation documents, including the statement of work and evaluation criteria, are available for download on the Canada Buys website.

**Pricing Information**
---------------------

* Estimated quantity of commodity: see solicitation document for details
* Basis of payment: see solicitation document for details

**Contact Information**
---------------------

* Procurement Information: [procurement@csc-scc.gc.ca](mailto:procurement@csc-scc.gc.ca)
* Phone: 236-380-2294
* Email: [katie.mckeever@csc-scc.gc.ca](mailto:katie.mckeever@csc-scc.gc.ca)

Please note that the bid submission deadline is July 22, 2024, at 5:00 PM EST. Late submissions will not be accepted. cybersecurityadvisory
